p: These associations are mirrored in emotional dispositions as individuals with a higher score in beneficiary or perpetrator sensitivity are more prone to experience guilt than those with a lower score. In contrast, individuals with a higher score in observer sensitivity tend to more easily be outraged than those with a lower score. Finally, individuals with a higher score in the area of victim sensitivity are inclined to feel more anger than those with a lower score (Preiser and Beierlein, 2017).
